alert.note: Alert for Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 03 at 12:31PM PST until March 05 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Winter Weather Returns Friday into Saturday... .A cold weather system will bring moderate snow to the southern Cascades and northern Sierra Nevada Friday afternoon through mid- day Saturday. Lowering snow levels Friday evening into early Saturday morning will bring snow down into the upper Sierra foothills. Those with travel plans to the mountains Friday afternoon and evening should plan for moderate snow showers and lowering snow levels, causing commute issues heading up to the mountains. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM FRIDAY TO 1 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...One to three inches of snow expected. Plan on slippery road conditions. * WHERE...Northeast Sierra Foothills and the Mother Lode. * WHEN...10 PM Friday to 1 PM Saturday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibilities at times. Snow levels will be lowering to 1500 feet by Saturday morning, so light accumulations on grassy surfaces will be possible. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
